title: Centre rebuts Farooq Abdullah's statement, asks why this sell out to separatists
text:
Farooq Abdullah said Kashmiri militants are sacrificing their lives to demand their rights. (ANI) In a hard hitting rebuttal to former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah’s yesterday’s statement that “bullet for bullet” cannot be allowed in the state, the Centre has said that his comment was like “policy of live in India and speak like foes”. It also said that Farooq’s statement was highly immature and anti-national, the ‘Times Now’ has said. Asking why this sellout to separatists, the Centre also said NC supremo was backing Pakistan back agents and legitimised stonepelters.
Targeting senior Congress leader P Chidambaram it also said that the Farooq Abdullah’s comment had the support of the later.
Abdullah had yesterday said that India and Pakistan should resolve their issues on Kashmir because answer to bullets cannot be bullets. But he hailed the courage of militants who can give their lives for freedom of Kashmir. “They have left homes for this cause. If somebody tells them, we will answer bullets with bullets. They didn’t fear bullets then (1990) why will they fear now. We have to save our nation now,” said the National Conference leader.
He had also said that Kashmiri militants are sacrificing their lives to demand their rights. “They (militants) are giving sacrifices to demand their right, ‘this is our land and we are its rightful owners’. When our boys are rendering sacrifices, they are not aspiring to become MLAs, MPs or ministers,” said Abdullah. He was at a conference, he was addressing some people. He said, “Give us our land back. Don’t forget they (militants) have left everything (for freedom).

“No one wants to die. But these people have made a promise to their god, who gives us life and takes it,” he said. “But to liberate our nation we will give our lives, they (India) do not still understand neither does Pakistan. This battle started in 1931, we are no one’s enemy. But we are telling these countries to do justice to us, he exclaims.
